intro: Ruellia tubiflora f. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full sunlight. Ruellia tubiflora f. alba is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
